title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Hello. Got this board here that shuts itself down when stressed. I thought initially it was bad battery because it was indeed bad. So I replaced it three times and same thing. Decided putting in an original battery that's working perfectly on another machine and problem persists, so I discarded battery issue. I then started digging for the problem. As lots of these boards have GPU issues, I decided to flash GMUX with DOSDUDE method, but problem persists. ASD detects no issues with any sensors. The machine has problems with power connected and just on battery. Using genuine(bought directly from apple) 85W magsafe charger, so charger is not the issue here also. A strange thing I noticed is that when running on battery, if I launch coconut battery, even with GPU disabled, it gives some peaks of more than 60W of consumption, probably an error on sensor readings... I verified R7020/21 and R7050/51 and they read ok. Replaced U7000, Q7030/35 and Q7080 just in case. Same issue, although read consumption lowered in average after replacing them, but still having random shut downs, also no matter if original battery or replacement one and no matter if it's on charger or on battery. I'm going nuts with this machine, it's a rabbit hole to hell...

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message:
Same problem in safe mode?

If you disabled GPU, remove also R8900/01.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Didn’t test in safe mode neither removed those resistors. Will do it on Monday and let you know

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: I removed the resistors, same problem. In safe mode the problem appears to not occur, probably because of the lack of video drivers, so the machine does not draw much power.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Check starting in SMC bypass too.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Not happening in SMC bypass mode

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message:
Then must be a problem with a SMC sensor.
Install HWMonitor and check for strange values.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: I tried HWMonitor, but could not find any strange values...

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: I'm suspecting SMC itself being bad, but have no donor boards of this model to take it from.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message:
Did you test with original battery from A1286/2012 for sure?
I saw many weird issues on this model with new chinese batteries.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Yes, tested with original battery, taken from working laptop with never replaced battery.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: As I told, also, problem occurs either on battery or charger power with genuine 85W power supply.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message:
These machines have also strange behavior if no good battery connected.

Instal gfxcardstatus and test the machine with iGPU and dGPU also.
See if only fails with discrete GPU enabled.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Discrete GPU is permanently disabled, as told on the first post. I killed it with DosDude method.

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message:
Never tried that method.
Hardware mod suppose more work, but may be the solution of this problem.
Just try it, if have time...

title: 820-3330 Shutting Off Intermittently
message: Testing it again now... Now HWMONITOR is telling me CPU RAIL (CPU Total) is consuming a whopping 65W(!!!!!). Think maybe I found where the problem is, but how to solve?
